titlestmt.titleproper: Notes, in shorthand, of Clinical Lectures probably given by James Gregory (d. 1731), Professor of Medicine, King's, Aberdeen

did.unittitle: Notes, in shorthand, of Clinical Lectures probably given by James Gregory (d. 1731), Professor of Medicine, King's, Aberdeen

physdesc.label: Extent and Medium of the Unit of Description

bioghist.head: Administrative/Biographical History
bioghist.p: James Gregory (d. 1731) was Professor of Medicine at King's College, Aberdeen. He was the son of James Gregory (1638-1675) the mathematician, and grandson of John Gregory (d. 1653).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The lectures are noted as having been taken down in 1705. They are written in shorthand. Type of shorthand is unknown. The writer is unknown. The notes in the volume cover 228 pages. Title page states Notes of Gregory's clinical lectures. There is a rear index of contents in longhand.
Note: James Gregory (d.1731) is probably the only Gregory among this fanous family able to have actually given lectures in 1705.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Item recivered during decant, 2007. Accession no: E2007.4.
